Record.Term: Murine Retrovirus Containing Human PDGFB cDNA
Record.ParentTerm: Gene Transfer or Gene Delivery Agent
Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Biological Agent/Gene Transfer or Gene Delivery Agent/Murine Retrovirus Containing Human PDGFB cDNA
Record.BroaderTerm: Murine Retrovirus Containing Human PDGFB cDNA
Gene Transfer or Gene Delivery Agent
Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Synonym: Murine Retrovirus Containing Human PDGFB cDNA
Record.Description: A murine retrovirus that contains plasmid DNA (cDNA) coding for the B chain of platelet-derived growth factor (PDGFB). Overexpressed in some human brain tumors, PDGFB and PDGF receptors may stimulate tumor development in an autocrine manner. A murine retrovirus containing human PDGFB cDNA may be used to induce brain tumors in animal models of brain tumorigenesis. (NCI04)
